wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Hay Ritchie (1822–1895) was an artist and engraver.  He was born in Glasgow, Scotland, and studied in the UK under Sir William Allan, before moving to New York in 1841. He specialised in mezzotints.

response: *Alexander Hay Ritchie (1822 – 1895, Scottish, moved to US)

link_mentions.page: First Reading of the Emancipation Proclamation of President Lincoln
response: When Lincoln had the painting exhibited to the public in the East Room of the White House, Carpenter noted that the exhibition was thronged with visitors. An engraving of the painting was made by Alexander Hay Ritchie for mass reproduction. The painting was well received by critics, according to newspaper advertisements for those reproductions; also, many of the subjects in the painting commented favorably. The painting itself then toured the country.
* Alexander Hay Ritchie (1822–1895), artist and engraver
